Hello,
     For the record, the thing I have noted is that a few of us are playing a large number of characters. I have been an avid RP'er for quite some time. I have played table-top (since the mid to late 80's), MUSH/MUX/MUD sites (since the early 90's) as well as PBeM's (for a couple of years now.) Usually the biggest problem you have when playing a lot of characters is focus. Generally table-top and MU*** sites are real time play so it VERY difficult to play more than 2 MAYBE 3 at a time without delays creeping in to the RP or characters becoming 2 dimentional with only a single line of post. Here on PBeM's, because you write when you are able, it is easier to play multi-characters however we still have problems. People tend to forget details of what all thier different characters are doing, where they are suppose to going, and what theier goals are.

I believe that is sorta what happened with Shard. 

When Robo left, myself and Airly picked up his characters, but now it is becoming a bit unwieldy as we try to remember what his characters are suppose to be doing in addition to what are own characters are doing. Perhaps we should scale back to a reasonable number, that way we can focus properly, and hopefully folks don't get lost in the overload. 

Right now I am running: Cyclonus, Scourge, Marauder (Malik), Rodimus, Lord Elder, Skorponok (and Zarak) - and then there are the minions. However up till now Cyc, Scourge and Rodimus have been unconscious and Skorponok has been largely silent, making it a bit easier, but that of course is changing. 

Perhaps I will drop a few of these in the very near furture to make things easier on me

I look forward to any comment or thoughts on ways we can make this place better. 

Preston




----- Original Message ----
Wrom: SQHYUCDDJBLVLMHAALPTCXLYRWTQTIPWIGYOKSTT
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2008 6:11:44 AM
Subject: Re: OOC: Shall we speak?


I know in the past there have been some RPs I have not been keeping 
up with, but at least I made that attempt to notify that I would be 
missing or not around if I was too busy. But when I had a little more 
time and could, I always come back to the RPs. My focus is upon the 
story and the regular interaction with other players. I'm telling a 
story not just for my own fun and benefit, but for those out there 
who may be lurking and reading theses stories. And believe me, people 
DO come and glance at these. I've had a fan base in the past from 
some of my role playing stories. Those stories only fail or end when 
other players do NOT remain involved. 

Get involved people! If you join ANY Role Playing game or story, you 
MUST realize that you should make that commitment to role play often. 
Take that time. Trust me, it's not that hard to do so. Otherwise, if 
no rules or guidelines have been laid down how often you should play, 
then state how often you can play OOC in the list or forum you are 
involved in. Get to know the story and how fast that pace is. 
Especially when you are interacting with other people... those people 
wait on you. Some RPs I've been in in the past... people will 
continue to post and leave you behind if you can't keep up with a 
story. But your lack of commitment to something you joined is not the 
fault of others. 

Perhaps this is rude of me... but I've been doing this a long, long 
time.. these online role playing stories. I'm only passing along to 
you what was said to me and what has happened to me. It can be 
frustrating and turns people off when you are left behind. But there 
is a difference in how you are left behind. Don't be left behind at 
your own fault cause you refuse to take the time to post. Remember... 
you are affecting someone else. Another player's character is held up 
by you and they can't do anything until you post something, whether 
IC or OOC. 

You join, be committed. And use communication! 

~Lady B
